alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Marion; McPherson; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 5:32PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McPherson, northern Sedgwick, Harvey, northwestern Butler and southern Marion Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 532 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Halstead, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Newton, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Hesston, Maize, Halstead, Marion, North Newton, Moundridge, Sedgwick, Colwich, Peabody, Mount Hope, Whitewater, Florence, Kechi, Andale and Goessel. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 13 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central, central and east central Kansas.
